title: Help me pls
content:
Hi, what is this font please?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130818070758im_/http:/typophile.com/files/!!!!!!!!!!_5105.png)
author: kotena

comments.content: Those are the typical type style of a letterpress serial numbering device's output, and while someone may have made a font that will match it, I have been unable to find it for you, but my comment may give you a better idea of what to look for.

Thanks George for the insight.  
These numbers combine an "over rounded" geometric letter style -- somewhat similar to Helvetica -- with an open top 4; characteristics that are found in some 19th century fonts, but very rarely in modern digital fonts.  
The closest I found were the numbers in a font designed by Steffen Sauerteig as a machine readable font using 1990s technology: [Typestar](http://web.archive.org/web/20130818070758/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/ff-typestar/).  
Don
